Name: Bill Gates
Bio: About Bill GatesBill Gates turned his fortune from software firm Microsoft into diversified holdings including investments in zero-carbon energy companiesIn May 2021, Bill and Melinda Gates each announced on Twitter they were ending their marriage after 27 years. They still co-chair the charitable Gates Foundation.Gates, who cofounded Microsoft with Paul Allen (d. 2018) in 1975, transferred at least $6 billion worth of shares in public companies to Melinda as part of the divorce settlement.As of March 2020, when Gates stepped down from the Microsoft board, he owned about 1.3% of the software and computing company's shares.He has invested in dozens of companies including Republic Services and Deere & Co., and is one of the largest owners of farmland in the U.S.To date, Gates has donated more than $59 billion to the Gates Foundation, including a $20 billion gift announced in July 2022. Most of his early donations were gifts of Microsoft stock.

Additional_Information: Bill Gates was born on October 28, 1955, in Seattle, Washington, U.S.A. Gates' father, William H. Gates II, is a Seattle attorney. His mother, Mary Gates, was a schoolteacher before she became a homemaker. Gates has two sisters: Kristi (a director of a non-profit organization) and Libby (a businesswoman). Gates' childhood was spent in Seattle's affluent Laurelhurst neighborhood and he attended the private Lakeside Preparatory School. When he was in eighth grade, Lakeside integrated computer time into the curriculum—one hour a day, every day. Gates and his classmates used a Teletype Model 33 ASR to communicate with a PDP-10 time-sharing computer at the Computer Center Corporation (CCC).
awards_and_honorss:
-Gates was ranked as the richest person in the world by Forbes magazine in March 2014
-In 2015, Bill and Melinda Gates were ranked as the second most philanthropic people in America
-In 2017, Gates received the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation's highest civilian award, from President Donald Trump
philanthropy_activitiess: Bill Gates has donated $28 billion to charity.
early_lifee: Bill Gates was born on October 28, 1955, in Seattle, Washington. His father, William H. Gates II, is a Seattle attorney. His mother, Mary Gates, was a schoolteacher, University of Washington regent, and chairwoman of United Way International. His sister, Kristi Gates, is a former equestrian. Gates attended Lakeside School, an exclusive preparatory school where he befriended Paul Allen, a fellow student who shared his interest in computers. Gates began using computers when he was thirteen years old. He became a fascinated programmer, reading every book and magazine he could find on the subject. At Lakeside, he and Allen wrote a tic-tac-toe program that allowed users to play the popular game against the computer.
property_holdings: Bill Gates owns the company Microsoft, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, and Cascade Investments.
Careers:
Bill Gates is an American businessman, co-founder of the Microsoft Corporation, and one of the world’s richest people. He is also a philanthropist and has given away billions of dollars to charitable causes.

Gates was born in Seattle, Washington, on October 28, 1955. His father, William H. Gates II, is a Seattle attorney. His mother, Mary Gates, was a schoolteacher before she became a homemaker. Gates has an older sister, Kristi (Kristianne), and a younger sister, Libby. He was the fourth of his family’s five children.

As a child, Gates was intrigued by computers and how they worked. When he was 13, his parents allowed him to join the Lakeside School, a private preparatory school. At Lakeside, he and some friends started a computer programming club. They used a teletype machine that was connected to a computer at the University of Washington.

In 1973, Gates graduated from Lakeside School and began attending Harvard University. He enrolled in pre-law but later switched his major to computer science. Gates did not finish his degree at Harvard; he left in his junior year to start Microsoft with his childhood friend Paul Allen.

Gates and Allen started Microsoft in 1975. Their first product was a version of the programming language BASIC for the Altair 8800, one of the first personal computers. In 1980, Microsoft released the operating system MS-DOS, which became the standard operating system for personal computers.

In 1985, Microsoft released Microsoft Windows, a graphical extension to MS-DOS. Windows eventually became the most widely used operating system in the world. In 1986, Gates and Allen formed a joint venture with Apple Computer, Inc., to develop and sell a graphical user interface (GUI) for the Apple Macintosh.

In the 1990s, Gates oversaw the development of Microsoft Office, a suite of applications that includes word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation programs. In 1995, Microsoft released Windows 95, a major upgrade to the Windows operating system.

In 2000, Gates stepped down as Microsoft’s CEO but remained as chairman of the board. In 2006, he transitioned to a new role as chief software architect, and in 2008, he took on a new role as adviser on key projects. Gates is currently working on a number of projects at Microsoft, including the development of next-generation computer technologies.
